Key Match Events: The Miami Heat defeated the New Orleans Pelicans by a final score of 119-108.
Jimmy Butler was benched for the entire fourth quarter despite being reinserted into the starting lineup after a five-game absence.
Erik Spoelstra noted that Butler's benching was due to his 13-day absence and the strong performance of the group on the floor.
Post-Match Reflections: Erik Spoelstra explained his decision to bench Jimmy Butler, citing Butler's long absence and the effective play of the group on the floor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New Orleans Pelicans suffered their 11th-straight loss, making them the NBA's worst team with a 5-29 record.
The Miami Heat improved their overall record to 17-14, placing them sixth in the Eastern Conference standings.
